properties.headline: Cycle ride - Thursday 19 and Friday 20 March - CANBERRA TO THREDBO Capital Circuit to Friday Drive, Kosciuszko National Park
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 50 cyclists will be taking part in the Kosi Challenge Ride4Rare Parliament to the Peak Cycle Challenge travelling from Canberra to Thredbo on Thursday 19 and Friday 20 March. 

On Thursday, cyclists will travel from Canberra to Cooma via Capital Circuit, Kings Ave, State Circuit, Brisbane Ave, Wentworth Ave, Monaro Hwy and Sharp St between 9am and 3:45pm.

On Friday, cyclists will travel from Cooma to Thredbo via Sharp St, Kosciuszko Rd, Jindabyne Rd, Bay St, Alpine Way and Friday Dr between 9am and 5:30pm.

No road or lane closures will be in place and cyclists will be sharing roads with motorists abiding by regular road rules.

Motorists are advised to exercise caution and remember when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.
properties.displayName: Cycle ride - Thursday 19 and Friday 20 March

properties.headline: A-League - Saturday 14 March - KOGARAH Jubilee Ave, English St and Park St at Princes Hwy
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Sydney FC v Perth Glory at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium from 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as large crowds travel to and from the stadium. 

Road closures will be in place from 4pm on the following roads around the stadium:

  • Jubilee Ave between the Princes Hwy and Park St
  • English St between the Princes Hwy and High St
  • Park St between Jubilee Ave and English St

Roads will re-open an hour after full-time or once crowds have cleared the area.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Ave, English St and Park St

properties.headline: Bobbin Head Cycle Classic - Sunday 29 March - TURRAMURRA, KUR-RING-GAI CHASE NATIONAL PARK, ST IVES Bobbin Head Rd, Mona Vale Rd
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bobbin Head Cycle Classic - Mona Vale Rd Clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bobbin Head Cycle Classic - Mona Vale Rd Clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 5,000 riders will participate in the annual Bobbin Head Cycle Classic in one of 4 events including a 104km, 80km, 57km or 27km course travelling from Turramurra through Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park and return. Events start from 6.30am.

Road and lane closures will be in place along the course at various locations and times between 5am and 3pm including sections of Karuah Rd, Turramurra Ave, Bobbin Head Rd, Warrimoo Ave, Woodbury Rd, Liberator General San Martin Drive, Old Pacific Hwy and Mona Vale Rd through Turramurra, Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park, Mt Colah and St Ives.

Speed limit reductions will be in effect between 6:15am and 1:30pm along sections of Mona Vale Rd, West Head Rd, Bobbin Head Rd, McCarrs Creek Rd and Pacific Hwy.

Special event clearways will be in place along a section of the course in St Ives from 7am to 1:30pm on the eastern side of Mona Vale Rd from Property No.425 to Kitchener St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

ST IVES - FROM 7AM TO 1.30PM

  • Mona Vale Road between Property No.425 to Kitchener St (Eastern Side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
TURRAMURRA

FROM 5:00AM TO 3:00PM

  • Karuah Road between Eastern Road and Turramurra Avenue (both directions)
  • Turramurra Avenue between Brentwood Avenue and Karuah Road (northbound)  

FROM 8:00AM TO 1.45PM

  • Bobbin Head Road at the intersection of Burns Road (Northbound right turn lane)  

KU-RING-GAI CHASE NATIONAL PARK

FROM 6:15AM TO 9:15AM

  • Bobbin Head Road* between the Park Gates at North Turramurra and the Park Gates at Mt Colah (northbound) * Detour via Mt Colah

FROM 7:30 AM TO 12:30PM

  • Liberator General San Martin Drive* between Cottage Point Road and West Head Road (northbound) * Access to Cottage Point unaffected 

TERREY HILLS

FROM 6.30AM TO 2.30PM

  • Mona Vale Road Left hand westbound lane at intersection of Myoora Rd/Forest way (Kerb Lane)

MOUNT COLAH

FROM 6:15AM TO 8:45AM

  • Old Pacific Highway approaching the intersection of Belmont Parade (kerb lanes in both directions)  

ST IVES

FROM 6:45AM TO 1:30PM

  • Warrimoo Avenue between Killeaton Street and Mungarra Avenue (northbound)

FROM 8:30AM TO 1:30PM

  • Woodbury Road between Mona Vale Road and Hume Avenue (eastbound)
  • Mona Vale Road approaching the intersection of Richmond Road (westbound kerb lane)
arrangementElements.title: Road and Lane Closures

arrangementElements.html:
The speed limit will be temporarily reduced for the safety of cyclists riding amongst vehicle traffic at the following locations and times. Speed limit reductions affects both directions unless stated otherwise.

SPEED LIMIT REDUCED FROM 90KM/H TO 60KM/H:

  • 7am to 10.45am - St Ives to Terrey Hills on the eastbound lanes of Mona Vale Road between Wildflower Gardens and Myoora Road
  • 8am to 1.45pm - Terrey Hills to St Ives on the westbound lanes of Mona Vale Road between Forest Way and the Wildflower Gardens      

SPEED LIMIT REDUCED FROM 80KM/H TO 60KM/H:

7am to 12pm - Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park

  • West Head Road eastbound between Liberator General San Martin Drive and West Head Picnic Area
  • West Head Road westbound between West Head Picnic Area and Liberator General San Martin Drive

6.30am to 8.30am - Mount Colah eastbound lanes of Bobbin Head Road from the Park Gates to Kalkari Visitor Centre

SPEED LIMIT REDUCED FROM 60KM/H TO 40KM/H:

  • 6.15am to 8.45am - Mount Colah, both directions on the Pacific Highway between Pacific Highway and Belmont Parade
  • 7.30am to 10.45am - Terrey Hills in both directions on McCarr’s Creek Road between West Head Road and Liberator General San Martin Drive
arrangementElements.title: Speed Limit Reductions

properties.headline: Festival & Parade - Friday 3 to Sunday 5 April - COWRA Kendal St/Mid Western Hwy between Lachlan St AND Darling St
properties.otherAdvice:
The Cowra Festival of International Understanding is taking place from Friday 3 to Sunday 5 April.

On Saturday a parade will travel along Bartlett St, Brisbane St, Kendal St, Lachlan St and ending at the car park from 3pm to 4pm.

Kendal St/Mid Western Hwy between Lachlan St and Darling St and sections of Bartlett Ave will be closed between 3pm and 4pm. Low Level Bridge Rd will close from 3pm until 9pm, and Darling St from Kendal St to Bartlett St will also close from 1:30pm until 2pm.

Motorists will be detoured via College Dr, Liverpool St and Lachlan St in both directions. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.
properties.displayName: Festival & Parade - Friday 3 to Sunday 5 April

properties.headline: Bathurst Cycling Classic - Saturday 14 & Sunday 15 March - BATHURST Mount Panorama, William St, Panorama Ave and various local roads
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of riders will take part in the annual Bathurst Cycling Classic on Saturday 14 and Sunday 15 March. On Saturday riders will ride around Mount Panorama Motor Racing Circuit. On Sunday riders will travel from Mount Panorama to roads around Bathurst.

Roads will be closed on Sunday between 7am and 3pm including sections of William St, Panorama Ave, Mount Panorama Racetrack, Lloyds Rd, Gormans Hill Rd, Lagoon Rd, Ryans Rd, Rockley Rd, Lachlan Rd, Cow Flat Rd, Trunkey Rd and Vale Rd. 

Motorists will be detoured via local roads. Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and to follow instruction of traffic controllers on site.

No road closures will be in place on Saturday 14 March.

arrangementElements.html:
Day 2 - Sunday 15 March - Bathurst to Bathurst – 50km and 100km events between 6am to 3pm

Bathurst road closures:

  • 7am to 3pm: William St and Panorama Ave (Start/Finish sites)
  • 7am to 2.30pm: Lloyds Rd – Mount Panorama to Gormans Hill
  • 7.30am to 2.15pm: Vale Rd – Georges Plains to Bathurst
  • 7.30am to 2pm: Lachlan Rd – Rockley to Caloola
  • 7.30am to 1.30pm: Trunkey Rd – Caloola to Georges Plains
  • 7.30am to 1pm: Ryans Rd – The Lagoon to Rockley Mount
  • 7.30am to 1pm: Cow Flat Rd – Rockley Mount to Georges Plains
  • 7.30am to 12.30pm: Lagoon Rd – Orton Park to The Lagoon
  • 7.30am to 12.30pm: Rockley Rd – Rockley Mount to Rockley
  • 7.30am to 12pm: Gormans Hill Rd – Gormans Hill to Orton Park
  • 7am to 10.30am: Mount Panorama Racetrack (entire racetrack)
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

webLinks.linkText: St Patrick's Day Festival - site map

properties.headline: St Patrick's Day Festival - Sunday 15 March - THE ROCKS George St, Hickson Rd between Essex St AND the Overseas Passenger Terminal
properties.publicTransport: Attendees are encouraged to catch public transport with Circular Quay within short walking distance. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Local road closures will be in place in The Rocks area as large crowds celebrate St Patrick’s Day. A festival will be held in First Fleet Park from 11.30am to 5.30pm. A parade will kick off the celebrations at 11am starting from Hickson Rd at George St travelling south on George St to First Fleet Park by 12pm midday.

Roads will be closed from 10am to 1pm including George St from Essex St to Hickson Rd, Hickson Rd at the Overseas Passenger Terminal and Circular Quay West. 

Note the regular closure of George St between Hickson Rd and Lower Fort St for The Rocks markets will be in place from 4am Saturday 14 March and remain in place until midnight Wednesday 18 March for ongoing events.

Motorists should allow extra travel time through the area and exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on local roads throughout the day.

arrangementElements.html:
THE ROCKS

FROM 4AM SATURDAY 14 MARCH TO 1AM MONDAY 16 MARCH

  • George St 1 between Hickson Rd and Lower Fort St

Notes: 1 Standard road closure in place for The Rocks Markets, extended for post-event operations.

FROM 7PM MONDAY 16 MARCH TO 12AM MIDNIGHT WEDNESDAY 18 MARCH

  • George St 2 between Hickson Rd and Lower Fort St

Notes: 2 Road Closure in place from Monday till Wednesday for St Patricks Day Breakfast Event.

FROM 10AM TO 1PM - SUNDAY 15 MARCH

  • George St 2 between Essex St and Hickson Rd
  • Hickson Rd between Overseas Passenger Terminal upper roadway driveway and George St
  • Circular Quay West between George St and the end of the street

Notes: 2 Managed access will be provided for the Four Seasons Hotel (No Access once the parade commences).
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.displayName: St Patrick's Day Festival - Sunday 15 March

properties.headline: NRL - Sunday 15 March - WOLLONGONG Harbour Street and Burelli street at WIN Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Wests Tigers from 6:15pm at WIN Stadium. Prelim game from 3.45pm.

With large crowds expected traffic will be heavy on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to the game.

Roads around the stadium will close from 2:30pm until 8.30pm including Harbour St between Stewart St and Crown St and Burelli St between Corrimal St and Harbour St.

Motorists should expect delays and follow directions from traffic controllers on site.

properties.headline: Music Festival - Saturday 14 March - POKOLBIN McDonalds Rd at Broke Rd
properties.publicTransport: Buses run to and from the festival site from Gosford, Broadmeadow and Central Stations.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the sold out Wine Machine Festival at the Roche Estate in the Hunter Valley from 3pm. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Wine Country Dr, McDonalds Rd and Broke Rd approaching the site and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Attendees using the Hunter Expressway can exit at the Branxton Interchange and use Wine Country Dr and then either McDonalds Rd or Broke Rd to access the event.

properties.headline: NRL - Saturday 14 March - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Rd at Turton Rd
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Warriors at McDonald Jones Stadium from 3pm until 5pm. Preliminary game starts from 12:40pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as large crowds travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 22 March - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Rd at Turton Rd
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Newcastle Jets v Wellington Phoenix at McDonald Jones Stadium from 4pm until 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as large crowds travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: 2020 AFL Hunter Central Coast Men’s Invitational

properties.headline: Sports event - Saturday 14 March - TUGGERAH Lake Rd approaching Central Coast Regional Sporting & Recreation Complex
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 1,000 people are expected to attend the 2020 AFL Hunter Central Coast Men’s Invitational at the Central Coast Regional Sporting & Recreation Complex in Tuggerah from 9am until 5pm. 

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on the Pacific Hwy, Wyong Rd and Bryant Dr as attendees travel to and from the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.crossStreet: Central Coast Regional Sporting & Recreation Complex

webLinks.linkText: Singleton Council - Back to Singleton 2020 events

properties.headline: Local community event - Friday 13 March - SINGLETON John St between Ryan Ave North AND Ryan Ave South
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 5,000 people are expected to take part in community celebrations for the Singleton Bicentenary Homecoming Party on John St from 6pm until 11pm. 

Road closures will be in place from 2pm to 11pm on John St between Ryan Ave North and Ryan Ave South, as well as sections of Pitt St, Castlereagh St, York St and Burns Lane approaching John St.

Motorists will be detoured around John St via Ryan Ave in both directions.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual in the area while roads are closed and on detour routes.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, follow the direction of traffic control on site and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: Street parade - Saturday 4 April - COBAR Marshall St/Barrier Hwy between Lewis St AND Frederick St
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Grey Mardi Gras street parade along Marshall St/Barrier Hwy.

Marshall St/Barrier Hwy will close between Lewis St/Barton St and Frederick St from 9am until 2pm. Motorists will be detoured via Louth Rd. 

Motorists should allow additional travel time, follow the directions of traffic controllers and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: NRL - Thursday 12 March - PARRAMATTA O'Connell St at Victoria Rd
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Bulldogs at Bankwest Stadium from 8pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd as large crowds travel to the stadium during Thursday evening peak. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

Roads around the stadium will close prior to full-time and reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct including:

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and detour around the closures via Parkes St, Harris St, Macarthur St and Isabella St or Victoria Rd instead to avoid delays.

properties.headline: March - Friday 13 March - CAMPERDOWN TO SYDNEY CBD City Rd, Broadway, George St, Lee St, Pitt St and Park St
properties.publicTransport: Light rail and bus services may experience short term delays while the march is underway. Check transportnsw.info for service alerts.
properties.otherAdvice:
A march is underway travelling to Town Hall.

Rolling road closures are in place on sections of City Rd, Broadway, George St, Lee St, Pitt St and Park St.

Roads will progressively reopen behind the group as the march travels along the route under NSW Police escort. All roads expected to be open by 1.45pm

arrangementElements.html:
CAMPERDOWN/CHIPPENDALE/HAYMARKET/SYDNEY CBD/ULTIMO

FROM 12PM UNTIL 1:45PM

  • City Rd between Carillon Ave and Broadway (northbound)
  • Broadway between City Rd and Harris St (eastbound)
  • George St between Harris St and Quay St (eastbound)
  • Lee St between Pitt St and Regent St (both directions)
  • Pitt St between George St and Park St  
  • Park St between Pitt St and George St (westbound)
